text: Charlie Kirk was a man of incredible faith and an exemplary father and husband, who worked tirelessly to give a voice to the younger generation and the conservative movement by engaging in dialogue with opposing viewpoints. He was doing exactly that when he was senselessly assassinated. Family, friends, and leaders from across the country will join today to mourn his passing. I was proud to support the resolution we passed this week in the House that honored the life and legacy of Charlie and offering our condolences to his family, while condemning his assassination and all political violence.

It’s National Truck Driver Appreciation Week. Thank you to the 3.6 million truck drivers—and all who work in the industry—who make sure that groceries, household goods, building materials, and everything else gets where it needs to go. We depend on you! #thankatrucker

The brutal murder of Irina Zarutska should be a wakeup call for us all. We have to stop the violent crime plaguing our nation’s transit systems.

I invited Kansas City Chief of Police Stacey Graves to the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee’s roundtable today to share her experience with crime on our transit systems and how to combat it.

I appreciate her willingness to share her insight with the Committee today.

In our tech-driven world, the odds are good you’re reading this post on an app right now. Today is National App Challenge Day. Every year, I host the Congressional App Challenge for any student in North Missouri who is interested in coding and creating apps. It’s never too early to create the next big app. Any interested middle or high schooler should apply today at https://t.co/LeFEKgfnzx. #NationalAppChallengeDay #Code4Congress

It's been 24 years, but we don't forget where we were that day. Today, we pause and remember those we lost, the families and friends who still grieve, and the heroes who sacrificed everything to save the lives of their fellow Americans.

Shortly after the attacks, I did an interview with KMA Radio. You can listen to that interview here - https://t.co/P0ymjWAFyz

Charlie Kirk wasn’t just an inspiration to millions of Americans, he was a son, a husband, and a father.

Because of the vile and hateful actions of a cowardly assassin today, he was taken from his young family far too soon.

No American should be afraid to speak up for what they believe in. Join me in praying for his family and friends as they grieve this loss and pray for our nation.
Join me in praying for Charlie Kirk, who was shot at an event at a university today. Keep his family and all affected in your prayers as well.

Great job by the Coast Guard keeping these drugs off our shores. This is why I worked with President Trump to make a major investment in the USCG, giving them the tools they need to keep our maritime borders secure.

The murder of Iryna Zarutska in Charlotte is horrific. No one should fear for their life on a public transit system. This is what happens when the left allows criminals to run loose in our cities.  I commend @SecDuffy for targeting crime on our transit systems and I’ll work with him to ensure safety is a priority.

Great to get my bill to dramatically reform FEMA through the Transportation Committee today. Communities across North Missouri have faced countless tornados and floods over the years. Yet, FEMA never seems to get the job done when it comes to recovery efforts. The FEMA Act will help disaster survivors access aid quicker, by cutting the bureaucracy and red tape. This bill ensures FEMA will help, not hurt, communities in the wake of a disaster and I look forward to it going to the House floor. https://t.co/0JBd8WDGLr

This morning’s shooting at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis is heartbreaking. My prayers are with the children, their families, the teachers, and the entire community impacted by this heinous act of violence.

It’s National Aviation Week! I had the opportunity to speak this week at the 4 States Airport Conference in Kansas City about the critical funding that the One Big Beautiful Bill puts towards modernizing our nation’s air traffic control system.

We also discussed the importance of the FAA Reauthorization Act that was signed into law and the future of aviation.

Thanks to all who attended and to the 4 States Airport Conference for hosting me!

Congratulations to my good friend Catherine Hanaway on her appointment as the next Attorney General for Missouri. She is committed to the rule of law and has a long history of public service to our great state. She’s a great choice by @GovMikeKehoe and will do an excellent job ensuring that law and order is a priority for Missouri.

Congratulations to Missouri Attorney General Andrew Bailey on being named Co-Deputy Director of the FBI.

He's been an incredible asset to our state and his oversight and leadership will help restore law and order across the country.

I've been saying the St. Louis Processing and Delivery Center was a black hole and mail went there to die, but it turns out that was an understatement. 
 
Following repeated calls for an investigation into the mail issues there from me and my colleagues in Missouri and Illinois, the USPS Office of Inspector General released their findings from the audit they conducted over the last 3 months at the St. Louis facility.
 
In just two days in June, almost 2.6 million pieces of mail were delayed. If that wasn’t bad enough, they only reported around 1.5 million pieces as delayed. They weren't even reporting the missed mail correctly! On top of that, over 50% of all outbound mail trips from the STL processing facility from May 2024 - April 2025 were late or canceled. Local carriers can’t deliver the mail if it doesn’t get to them. That’s completely unacceptable.
 
Management acknowledges that there were issues and promised to fix them. That’s not gonna cut it. It’s time for management to go and the Postal Service needs to overhaul this facility completely so Northeast Missouri can start getting their mail on time once again. 
 
You can view the full audit here >>> https://t.co/LnUkbFYczO

When a trail sponsor petitions the government to turn an old rail line into a recreational trail, landowners should have a seat at the table. Trail sponsors should be footing the bill for the land, not the American taxpayers. I reintroduced the Rails to Trails Landowner Rights Act today so landowners are protected and compensated. https://t.co/4xHigxkImK

The One Big Beautiful Bill delivers historic tax relief for families, seniors and American workers. It cuts wasteful spending, secures the border, and unleashes American energy, while ensuring we have a strong military. 

As Chairman of the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee, I’m proud that we were able to include major investments in the U.S. Coast Guard to strengthen our border and national security. It will also jumpstart the process of modernizing our nation’s aging air traffic control system and hiring more air traffic controllers to keep the flying public safe. 

This bill makes good on President Trump’s America First agenda and I look forward to seeing it signed into law.

https://t.co/K2ssow5sq6

For Operation Midnight Hammer, Missouri was the tip of the spear. All operational B-2 bombers are based at @Whiteman_AFB, where the active-duty 509th Bomb Wing and @Missouri_NG @131stBombWing train, fly, and maintain the fleet together for the @USAIrForce.  
 
Missouri’s Air Force doctors use advanced fatigue management to keep pilots mission-ready for the extreme longe-range flights.
 
From Airmen and aircraft to medical support, Missouri powers America’s nuclear-capable stealth bomber force.

Awesome footage of the B-2 preparing for and returning from Operation “Midnight Hammer”! Flawless execution by Missouri’s Whiteman Air Force Base! God bless our troops and the work they do to protect us.

Incredible work by the men and women from the 509th Bomb Wing at Whiteman Air Force Base who successfully carried out last night's mission. An absolutely stellar job by all. Missouri is so proud.

May God bless and protect our troops around the world. https://t.co/od9xRDf1Vw

On June 6, 1944, more than 150,000 Allied troops launched the largest amphibious invasion in history. Paratroopers dropped into Normandy under cover of darkness, followed by landing vessels storming over 50 miles of fortified coastline. By day’s end, the Allies had broken through Hitler’s Atlantic Wall and secured all five beachheads.

Leading the assault was General Omar Bradley, a proud Missouri native from Randolph County, whose steady leadership helped turn the tide of the war. He went on to command over 1.3 million troops and retired as our nation’s last five-star General.

Over 9,000 young men gave their lives or were wounded that day to secure freedom for millions. On this 81stanniversary of D-Day, join me in pausing to remember those brave heroes and those who served and sacrificed for this great country during that time in our Nation’s history, ensuring we remain free today.

Today, I had the honor of presenting a Congressional Record to Sixth District constituent Tony Reinhart in recognition of his 30 years of service with Ford Motor Company. Tony currently serves as Ford’s Head of State, Local & Stakeholder Government Affairs, where he helps lead efforts to strengthen the American auto industry, particularly at Claycomo.

His leadership has had a powerful impact not just on the auto industry, but on the Northland of Kansas City as well. Tony’s contributions to organizations and civic groups across the Northland have been significant and impactful to the community. Congratulations, Tony, on this incredible milestone!

The Missouri National Guard’s 139th Airlift Wing's Operations Group in St. Joseph recently pulled off a legendary feat during a four-day exercise simulating a cyber-attack.
“Operations Goes Dark” was successfully executed by conducting normal operations without internet, GPS, or phones. Airmen coordinated missions using hand signals, runners, smoke signals, and old-school tactics to get the job done. 
Proud to see the 139th setting the bar not just for Missouri, but for the entire Department of Defense. @SecDef  @SecAFOfficial  @OfficialCSAF  @usairforce  @139AW  @AirMobilityCmd  @Missouri_NG  #warfighting #lethality #cyberwarfare #electronicwarfare

The HALT Fentanyl Act ensures law enforcement can continue to seize fentanyl-related substances both at the border and on the street.
 
We’ve got to keep this dangerous drug out of our communities and this bill helps do exactly that.

I just voted for the HALT Fentanyl Act, which permanently makes fentanyl and related substances Schedule I drugs.
 
Fentanyl is a scourge on America. It’s the leading cause of death for adults 18-49.

The NTSB is in the early stages of its investigation and I caution everyone to not get ahead of the facts or draw any conclusions.

Since the accident at Reagan Airport, I've been in regular contact with NTSB Chair Homendy, DOT Secretary Duffy & others. Yesterday, T&I leaders received a briefing from NTSB &FAA, and I'll ensure Congress is kept up to date on developments.

I’m praying for all involved in tonight's midair collision in Washington, DC, as well as the ongoing rescue operation. I'm in contact with the FAA and the NTSB and will continue to monitor the situation.
